name: Power station
description: Power Station surrounded by woods on edge of lake in Belanovia

groups.name: Safety Critical Network
groups.description: The safety critical network controlling the power generation process. The network includes the machinery used to control the plant and all HMI interfaces.

groups.name: Enterprise Network
groups.description: The enterprise network focusing on the Local Area network and the interconnections with the Wide Area Network and Internet.

groups.name: Physical Location
groups.description: The buildings and surrounding physical controls of the Trawsfynydd Site.

functions.name: Generate
functions.description:
Generate power for the surrounding population.  The plant has two reactors each generating 235 MW of electricity.

The plant draws water from the nearby lake for cooling.

functions.name: Distribute
functions.description: Store power ready to be supplied when demanded by the surrounding population across national grid.

functions.name: Maintain
functions.description: Maintain the operation of the plant via delivery of new fuel and dispose of spent fuel.

functions.name: Safety and Security
functions.description: Maintain cyber and physical security of the plant to prevent accidents.

assets.name: Turbine Building
assets.description: Houses the Turbines that generates the steam.

assets.name: Pump Building
assets.description: Houses the pumps that moves the coolant water around.

assets.name: Switch Compound
assets.description: This is the building that houses the switches to supply or received power from the electricity grid.

assets.name: Administration Block
assets.description:
This is where the power plant admin staff and operators are housed.

It has both the Power Station LAN and Enterprise WAN.

assets.name: Military Compound
assets.description: This is the military controlled accommodation.

assets.name: Reactor HMI and ICS
assets.description:
The reactor generates thermal heat by causing a nuclear reaction. 

The course control system is powered by the station 50V DC battery.

assets.name: Gas Turbines HMI and ICS
assets.description: The turbines are responsible for generating electricity from the stream generated by the thermal heat.

assets.name: Pump Water coolant House HMI and ICS
assets.description: The pumping station is required to deliver the water that is used to extract the heat from the gas and convert it into steam for the generators.

assets.name: Switch Compound HMI and ICS
assets.description: The power distribution system stores and switches the power generated to deliver to the national grid.

assets.name: Waste Treatment HMI and ICS
assets.description: Manages the nuclear waste material that is generated as a result of the Nuclear Reactors.

assets.name: Power Station LAN
assets.description: The enterprise network used to locally manage the ICT requirements of the Power plant.

assets.name: Power Station Enterprise WAN
assets.description: The enterprise network used to manage the wider ICT requirements of the Power plant including interconnections with other Power Stations and other organisation units belonging to the same organisation.

assets.name: Internet Access
assets.description: The connections with the Internet and any or all other organisations that require and ICT connection with the Trawsfynydd Power station and parent company.

assets.name: Military Network
assets.description: The military network that connects to other parts of the UK military network in order to meet the tasking order.

threats.purpose: This would allow them to Improve military standing, improve political standing with their neighbours, gain the upper hand in any diplomacy, improve Strategic International bargaining, impact their neighbours political or country borders.

threats.name: Terrorist
threats.motivation: Political, or Radical or Extremist behaviour to destabilise existing regimes
